alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 8:08PM EDT until September 08 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenfield, Montague, Northfield, Bernardston, Buckland, Shelburne, Colrain, Gill, Charlemont and Leyden. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
